name: Other performers, n.e.c.
lead statement: This unit group includes circus performers, magicians, models, puppeteers and other performers not elsewhere classified. They are employed by circuses, nightclubs, and theatre, advertising and other production companies, or they may be self-employed.
main duties: Entertain passers-by on sidewalks and in parks with magic tricks, juggling acts, short dramatic works, music and other entertaining displays.
Entertain audiences with thrilling and humorous acts.
Perform sleight-of-hand tricks, disappearing acts and other illusions.
Display clothing and merchandise in commercials, advertisements and fashion shows and pose for artists and photographers.
employment requirements: Circus performers and acrobats may require a period of study at a circus school.
Completion of modelling courses is usually required for models.
Training for other occupations in this unit group is often obtained under the guidance of a practitioner.
Talent and ability, as demonstrated during an audition, are important hiring criteria.
Membership in a guild or union related to the occupation or type or performance may be required.
additional information: There is little mobility between the different occupations in this unit group.
